level.text: Each child-placing agency shall have a written plan for recruitment of adoptive homes which shall include:
A child-placing agency that serves minority children shall have a plan for actively recruiting homes of the same race or ethnic category as the children.
Each child-placing agency shall provide the following information to prospective adoptive parents:
A statement of the agency’s purpose, philosophy, and policies;
The agency’s eligibility criteria, procedures, and responsibilities;
The approximate time the process will take;
Fee refund policies and procedures; and
Each adoptive applicant shall submit an application in writing on a form provided by the child-placing agency.
The applicant shall sign a statement acknowledging receipt of a copy of the child-placing agency’s policies as outlined in §1617.3 and such acknowledgment shall be maintained in the applicant’s file.
